turns.utterance: I am really afraid of clowns even though our modern clowns have been around since the 19th century.
turns.response: I don't blame you!  Clowns are creepy!  Hence the movie "IT".  Why do people have such a fear of them though?

turns.utterance: My fear is definitely from IT. Even though clowns are designed to entertain large audience
turns.response: Where did clowns get there start?  Was it the circus?

turns.utterance: Not sure but they go back to at least the 1800s when Joseph Grimaldi became the first mainstream clown
turns.response: Wow!  I didn't realize they went back that far!  Who was Joseph Grimaldi and where was he from?

turns.utterance: Well he was a part of the British Pantomimes and expanded the rowl of the clown in that.
turns.response: Interesting.  I wouldn't have guessed a Brit was the first clown.  They have such dry humor!  Are there any other famous clowns?

turns.utterance: Pierrot was a very popular pantomime as well. He performed unmasked with a large white blouse and wide white pantaloons

phrase: i didnt mention anything about clowns.
